intro: Saussurea ionodasys, commonly known as the Tibetan safflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Tibetan medicine. Its roots and flowers are used to treat various ailments, including inflammation and digestive issues. Saussurea ionodasys thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
